messages.message: Hi team, I noticed our latest release still locks down conversations to 100 documents or less. When are we planning on fixing this in the UI?
cc: @Balaram

With 25.18 release, we will be support 500 documents or 20k chunks.

In Q2, this limit will be further increased (with weaviate scaling)

For internal users, one can opt in for "Enable Larger knowledge base with Converse and Chatbot".  This will allow them to upload files upto 20k chunks. At the front-end, we will limit 100 files per upload.

cc: @margaret.tomaszczuk @Gauti

We are preparing for an army demo in mid may where they will put hands-on down in Ft. Huachuca. @Sam has a ST sandbox up so we can take 25.18 when it is available. Can you remind me what the env var is to update the front-end limit? Or is it that you can only get over 100 by using the api?

Once you opt-in for larger knowledge base, from the front-end you can make multiple uploads (100/upload) to the same conversation

With 25.18, the limit will be 500 files or 20k chunks per conversation.
ok, thanks
Even with the current release, @Sam can opt-in and validate
great
@Balaram do you know what "enable identity passthrough for Search" does? That would be fantastic to demo if it is ready. I'm not sure what that looks like.
@Hari @abhijnan can you help here?

Enabling identity passthrough ensures that users have access to individual files used to generate the search response, without it the only permission check performed is if the user has access to the data source queried.
got it, thanks. @abhijnan would this only be appropriate in SSO implementations? I am not sure what identity is used or is it just within our workspace permissions?
Just workspace permissions
Hey team, this isn't ready yet
that feature flag is OOD
identity passthrough for data sources is coming in 25.18 (may get pushed to 25.20)
ensures search results are personalized to the perms of the searcher as defined in 3rd party data sources
in the meantime, we enforce permission by workspace, as @abhijnan has indicated!
@Jason out of curiosity, how many docs are we looking at for demo?
I have 350 or so in arabic from the bin laden raids.
